Articles.Content:
Hi guys!

I've been trying to get to Gilly for a contract, but every time I go to launch and the physics load, the launchpad starts shaking violently, as if I'm in flight or something. I've glance over the forums and haven't seen this issue yet, so I apologize if it's been solved elsewhere. Below are two pictures of my ship, in case that's relevant. Those are not the only two versions, I've also tried using Kickbacks and Thumpers, but the problem persists. I've tried using dozens of struts, but the same thin happens. Is it the decouplers? Some weird atmo bug? Space goblins?

Also, I'm a beginner so my ship may be considered crap, but if you can tell just by looking that it's not gonna reach Gilly, please please don't tell me (failing is part of the fun and the discovery, right?)

Any help would be very appreciated! Thank you very much!

Hi Boise Profetul, the rocket looks fine but I don't know if it'll reach Gilly, but rescue missions are fun right?

I can't tell from the pics what might be going on, can you please upload your craft somewhere (dropbox is okay) and your KSP.log and output_log.txt, make sure they are from just after after this weirdness happens as KSP overwrites them on every game start.

If it's camera shake you could try disabling it in the options.
